page.title: 08THE ELY-ADELAIDE RAILWAY(i)
page.content: The railway line runs for 2 kilometres across our area from North-West to North-East.There is a very important junction at Adelaide where three lines diverge.One of the lines goes to Peterborough,another goes to Kings-Lynn and the third goes to Norwich.These lines are controlled from Ely North Junction Signal Box.The Signal Box was built in 1926 and contains hand operated levers to work the signals on the track.Sixteen trains go to Peterborough each day nine to Kings-Lynn and ten to Norwich.The railway lines cross the Ely-Prickwillow road at three level crossings which have gates operated from the Signal Box.In order from the Ely side they are called the Lynn, Peterborough and Norwich Road Crossings.
